name: Skate or die
description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

key_work.title: All This Mayhem
key_work.brief_description: A searing account of what happens when raw talent and extreme personalities collide. In this unflinching, never-before-seen account of drugs and the dark side of professional skateboarding, brothers Tas and Ben Pappas’ intense bond and charisma take them from the pinnacle of their sport into a spiraling world of self-destruction.

constellations_primary.name: Skate or die
constellations_primary.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

start.title: Skate Kitchen
start.creator_credit: Bow + Arrow Entertainment, Pulse Films, RT Features, Crystal Moselle, Fletcher Chancey, Matthew Perniciaro, Rodrigo Teixeira, Julia Nottingham, Michael Sherman, Izabella Tzenkova, Lizzie Nastro, Aslihan Ünaldı, Jen Silverman and Camille Garmendia

video_links.name: Skate Kitchen Official Trailer - Starring The Skate Kitchen and Jaden Smith

start.brief_description: Camille’s life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a group of girl skateboarders. As she journeys deeper into this raw New York City subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship as well as her inner self.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: Kids
end.creator_credit: Miramax, Shining Excalibur Films, Independent Pictures, Killer Films, Kim Marie Druce, Harmony Korine, Larry Clark, Cathy Konrad, Christine Vachon, Cary Woods and Kevin Thompson
end.brief_description: A controversial portrayal of teens in New York City which exposes a deeply disturbing world of sex and substance abuse.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Larry Clark’s controversial film Kids, written by Harmony Korine, also featured non-professional actors and skaters in their first acting roles, with Chloe Sevigny and Rosario Dawson both making their debut in the drug-fuelled and sexually exploitative depiction of teenage life.

start.title: All This Mayhem
start.brief_description: A searing account of what happens when raw talent and extreme personalities collide. In this unflinching, never-before-seen account of drugs and the dark side of professional skateboarding, brothers Tas and Ben Pappas’ intense bond and charisma take them from the pinnacle of their sport into a spiraling world of self-destruction.

constellations_primary.name: Skate or die
constellations_primary.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: Dogtown and Z-Boys
end.creator_credit: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
end.brief_description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Directed by Eddie Martin, All This Mayhem tells the story of two brothers from Melbourne, Ben and Tas Tappas, during the glory days of professional vert skateboarding in the 1990s. The documentary features archival footage, as does Dogtown and Z-Boys.

start.title: All This Mayhem
start.brief_description: A searing account of what happens when raw talent and extreme personalities collide. In this unflinching, never-before-seen account of drugs and the dark side of professional skateboarding, brothers Tas and Ben Pappas’ intense bond and charisma take them from the pinnacle of their sport into a spiraling world of self-destruction.

constellations_primary.name: Skate or die
constellations_primary.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Tony Hawk appears in archival footage of skateboarding competitions in All This Mayhem, though he declined to be interviewed in the film. In 1999, he released a video game, Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater, that became a hugely successful franchise.

start.title: This Ain't California
start.creator_credit: Wildfremd Production, ARTE, MDR, RBB, Marten Persiel, Ira Wedel, Simone Eichhorn, Michael Schöbel, Ronald Vietz and Anne Zentgraf
start.brief_description: A retrospective look at the youth cultures born in the German Democratic Republic. A celebration of the lust for life, a contemporary trip into the world of skate, a tale on three heroes and their boards, from their childhood in the seventies, through their teenage rebellion in the eighties and the summer of 1989, when their life changed forever, to 2011.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: Minding the Gap
end.creator_credit: ITVS, Kartemquin Films, P.O.V./American Documentary, Bing Liu and Diane Quon

video_links.name: Minding the Gap Full Trailer (Official) • A Hulu Original Documentary

end.brief_description: Three young men bond together to escape volatile families in their Rust Belt hometown. As they face adult responsibilities, unexpected revelations threaten their decade-long friendship.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Bing Liu’s debut film, Minding the Gap, is a documentary about three skateboarders and their personal experiences of family violence. Though it appeared to be centred on three best friends, the film’s subjects only became friends during the filming process.

start.title: Dogtown and Z-Boys
start.creator_credit: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
start.brief_description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: Lords of Dogtown
end.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, TriStar Pictures, Catherine Hardwicke, Stacy Peralta, John Linson, The Linson Company, Indelible Pictures, Senator International, Chris Gorak and Cindy Evans
end.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2005
end.brief_description: Lords of Dogtown tells the radical true story behind three teenage surfers from Venice Beach, California, who took skateboarding to the extreme and changed the world of sports forever.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Dogtown and Z-Boys, directed by Stacy Peralta, charts the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team in Southern California in the 1970s using archival Super 8 footage. The feature film Lords of Dogtown, also written by Peralta, dramatises the story.

start.title: Lords of Dogtown
start.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, TriStar Pictures, Catherine Hardwicke, Stacy Peralta, John Linson, The Linson Company, Indelible Pictures, Senator International, Chris Gorak and Cindy Evans
start.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2005
start.brief_description: Lords of Dogtown tells the radical true story behind three teenage surfers from Venice Beach, California, who took skateboarding to the extreme and changed the world of sports forever.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: Skate Kitchen
end.creator_credit: Bow + Arrow Entertainment, Pulse Films, RT Features, Crystal Moselle, Fletcher Chancey, Matthew Perniciaro, Rodrigo Teixeira, Julia Nottingham, Michael Sherman, Izabella Tzenkova, Lizzie Nastro, Aslihan Ünaldı, Jen Silverman and Camille Garmendia

video_links.name: Skate Kitchen Official Trailer - Starring The Skate Kitchen and Jaden Smith

end.brief_description: Camille’s life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a group of girl skateboarders. As she journeys deeper into this raw New York City subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship as well as her inner self.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: Unlike the male-dominated Lords of Dogtown, Skate Kitchen, directed by Crystal Moselle, portrays an all-female skate crew in New York City. The film was inspired by the real-life collective and members of the group play fictionalised versions of themselves.

start.title: Dogtown and Z-Boys
start.creator_credit: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
start.brief_description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

end.title: This Ain't California
end.creator_credit: Wildfremd Production, ARTE, MDR, RBB, Marten Persiel, Ira Wedel, Simone Eichhorn, Michael Schöbel, Ronald Vietz and Anne Zentgraf
end.brief_description: A retrospective look at the youth cultures born in the German Democratic Republic. A celebration of the lust for life, a contemporary trip into the world of skate, a tale on three heroes and their boards, from their childhood in the seventies, through their teenage rebellion in the eighties and the summer of 1989, when their life changed forever, to 2011.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

links.description: This Ain’t California explores skateboarding subculture in East Germany in the 1980s. Though the documentary claimed to feature original Super 8 film, it was later revealed that the subject, Denis Paracek, was a fictional character played by a contemporary skateboarder.
